cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 210 mi SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast and expected to turn northeast then east, skirting the North Carolina Outer Banks and then pulling away from the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Cape Hatteras / Outer Banks, NC
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (cyclone never approaches the west-central Florida / Tampa coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC; Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds (Tropical Storm Warning only, no separate watch issued)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC; Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastal North Carolina and adjacent Atlantic waters; outer coastal waters from South Carolina northward to Mid-Atlantic likely experience elevated seas and surf
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: N/A – storm remains several hundred miles east of Tampa at all times
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at Tampa; breeze remains dominated by local sea-breeze regime
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor long-period swells may reach west-Florida waters late week but operational impact expected to be minimal
